statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Northern Colorado hangs on for 72-71 win over North Dakota
article.headline: Northern Colorado hangs on for 72-71 win over North Dakota
article.linkText: Northern Colorado hangs on for 72-71 win over North Dakota
article.story: GREELEY, Colo. -- Cameron Michael scored 18 points, including five 3-pointers, and Dominique Lee sank the winning free throw as Northern Colorado hung on for a 72-71 win over North Dakota on Saturday night. Leading 42-28 at halftime, Northern Colorado (15-14, 10-8 Big Sky) had to hold off a North Dakota rally that tied the game at 71 on Quinton Hooker's bucket with two seconds left. Lee was then sent to the line after Dustin Hobaugh's foul, hitting 1 of 2 to put the Bears back on top before Hooker missed a 3-pointer at the other end as time expired. Tim Huskisson added 14 points before fouling out for Northern Colorado, which shot 49.1 percent on 53 attempts from the field to win its third straight and get the season sweep. Hooker scored 28 and Estan Tyler added 18 for North Dakota(8-22, 4-14), which outscored the Bears 43-30 in the second half.
